conclusion: Determine the area S of the cylindrical surface through which light exits.
The semi-cylindrical body has a radius R and length L. Light enters vertically through the rectangular surface and exits through the curved surface.
The refractive index of the semi-cylindrical body is n = 2.
Light refracts according to Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2, where n1 = 2 and n2 = 1.
The critical angle θc is the angle of incidence inside the medium at which the refracted angle is 90°: sin θc = 1/2, θc = 30°.
Light exits the curved surface only if the angle of incidence is less than the critical angle 30°.
The area of the curved surface is a portion of the semi-cylinder's surface area.
The total curved surface area of the semi-cylinder is πRL.
The angle subtended by the exiting light at the center of the semi-cylinder is 60°.
The fraction of the semi-circle corresponding to 60° is 1/3.
The area S is: S = (1/3) × πRL = πRL/3.
The area S of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is: S = πRL/3.
